derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  boren, past participle of beran 'to bear' (see bear)

entry.def: When a baby is born, it comes out of its mother's body at the beginning of its life. In formal English, if you say that someone is born of someone or to someone, you mean that person is their parent.

example.ex: My mother was 40 when I was born...
She was born in London on April 29, 1923...

entry.tran: 生下来（有某种疾病或问题）；天生（具有某种性格）
entry.def: If someone is born with a particular disease, problem, or characteristic, they have it from the time they are born.

example.ex: He was born with only one lung.
example.tran: 他生下来就只有一叶肺。

entry.def: You can use be born in front of a particular name to show that a person was given this name at birth, although they may be better known by another name.

example.ex: She was born Jenny Harvey on June 11, 1946.
example.tran: 她在1946年6月11号出生，取名叫珍妮·哈维。

entry.def: You use born to describe someone who has a natural ability to do a particular activity or job. For example, if you are a born cook, you have a natural ability to cook well.

example.tran: 杰克天生是个当老师的料。

entry.def: When an idea or organization is born, it comes into existence. If something is born of a particular emotion or activity, it exists as a result of that emotion or activity.

example.ex: The idea for the show was born in his hospital room...
example.tran: 这个节目的构思是他在医院病房里想出来的。

example.ex: Congress passed the National Security Act, and the CIA was born...
example.tran: 国会通过了《国家安全法》，中央情报局由此而诞生。
